title: Data Strategy Director / Strategy Director, Data
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
As a Data Strategy Director, you are a leader who helps frame opportunities on the account. Through directly managing or mentoring junior strategists you reinforce your own skillset. You aren’t just delegating; you create opportunities for people around you. You have a perspective on businesses and their data, speaking from knowledge and experience: granting you authority. 
What You’ll Do 
Establishing yourself as a trusted advisor to clients and a critical part of the client-facing leadership team from the agency with a deep knowledge of data, digital and multi-touchpoint marketing.
Consulting on the benefits / drawbacks of different analytics technique and various platforms tools,
Fronting pitches as the Data Lead across new agency pitches and specific B2B agency engagement
Providing actionable insight recommendations on multi-function discipline teams across performance media, market trends, and audience insights
Inspiring those around you to see data as a mission-critical capability that should be part of all (digital) engagements.
Structuring data architectures: why that form; which sources to use; where to find that data
Comfortable building and using segmentations and applying different modelling techniques
Scoping and managing different data strategy projects from data cleansing and enrichment to segmentation and analysis
Insightfully analyzing data sets at speed; helping others to raise the quality of their thinking
Coaching and developing more junior strategists in your team and supporting the broader agency strategy team to evolve and grow
What You’ll Need  
Acquiring new hard skills is less vital at this rather than working in higher profile and higher stakes settings. “Soft” skills become increasingly important including how to give feedback, prioritize and manage work streams.
Learning to be a leader; supporting and inspiring those around you to achieve their goals, be they different types of strategists or from other teams
Being able to flex your own approach according to different situations and audiences
Becoming more commercially aware, and able to spot opportunities for growth for both clients’ businesses and the agency
Leading the team and prioristising workloads based on skills and resource availability
Responsible for the individual career development across the entire team through regular career conversations
The qualities that will make you successful:
Manages people and helps them shine
Direct high-level client exposure
Commercially astute and accountable
Contributes back to the dept
Strong stage presence
Approx ~10-15 years’ experience
Takes accountability for work
 
 
You’re ready to move up when you are considered expert who can be a resource for the team at large. You have proven results and everyone recognizes the value you bring. You understand Ogilvy and what we do beyond your day to day. You can inspire and command a large and complicated team.
How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  
At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
